title: Meet Bavariscyllium: This 25-centimetre shark that lived 150 million years ago forced scientists to re-think shark evolution
desc: A remarkably preserved 150-million-year-old shark fossil is forcing researchers to reconsider how modern sharks evolved. The species, Bavariscyllium, displays a mix of features that do not align with today’s major shark groups.

title: Airbus says engine shortages are holding back plans to build more planes
desc: Aircraft maker blames supplier Pratt & Whitney for paring back output target as it tries to meet surging demand

title: Thai cops go undercover as lion dancers to nab suspected thief
desc: BANGKOK: Thai police donned a lion dance costume during this week's Lunar New Year festivities to arrest a suspect accused of stealing about $64,000 worth of Buddhist artefacts, police said Thursday (Feb 19).

title: South Korea's ex-president Yoon receives life sentence for imposing martial law
desc: Yoon Suk Yeol fell from office after an ill-advised attempt to overcome an opposition-controlled legislature by declaring martial law and sending troops to surround the legislature on Dec. 3, 2024.

title: South Korea’s ex-president jailed for life for masterminding an insurrection
desc: Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached and indicted for declaring martial law in 2024.

title: president jailed for life over martial law attempt
desc: Yoon Suk Yeol's December 2024 martial law bid fundamentally damaged South Korea's democracy, a judge told the court.

title: CANEX Creations Inc. Invests in Feature Film Clarissa, Acquired for Worldwide Distribution by NEON
desc: Cairo, Egypt — 19 February 2026 CANEX Creations Inc. (CCInc), the intellectual property investment subsidiary backed by Afreximbank’s Fund for Export Development in Africa (FEDA), today announced its investment in the feature film Clarissa, a Nigerian-produced drama directed by twin filmmakers Arie and Chuko Esiri. The film has been acquired for worldwide distribution by NEON,
